Conference<!-- --> <span class="BottomRecommendation_count__4HpLo">(<!-- -->20<!-- -->)</span></h3><div class="BottomRecommendationContent_root__2qm4_"><div class="mobile-recs"><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-0" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R8b6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R8b6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R8b6i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-the-cake-is-a-lie-uncovering-the-secret-world-of-malwarelike-cheats-in-video-games/201112400"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:0" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/santiagopontirolifinal-191203232734-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/santiagopontirolifinal-191203232734-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The cake is a lie! Uncovering the secret world of mal... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r8b6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r8b6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r8b6i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r8b6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r8b6i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Santiago Pontiroli

With more than 2.5 billion gamers from all over the world, it&#x27;s no wonder that at least a fraction of them would bring into action additional tools to gain an unfair advantage over their opponents in the virtual world. This is one of the many reasons behind the existence and rapid growth of a multi-million dollar industry that thrives on selling cheats, hacks and modifications to desperate gamers seeking to gain the upper hand in their next match. Let&#x27;s dissect these tools and understand how modern games and anti-cheating technologies can be easily bypassed, all while we get a glimpse of the dubious market and supporting crews that develop, sell, and maintain the commodities in this illegal economy. It&#x27;s not unusual for cheats to be more expensive than the actual games they are trying to profit from, or for players to buy a single title over and over until they can avoid being banned by the protective measures implemented in the first place. Fortnite? Overwatch? League of Legends? If you&#x27;ve heard about these games but you don&#x27;t know what an aim-bot, a wall-hack, or an ESP means, then you might finally understand why all those competitive matches you played have made you feel like a fish out of water. Join me in this presentation and learn the inside-out of an industry that has remained in the shadows for a very long time. I will be presenting real world cheats used by gamers worldwide that in some cases closely mimic techniques that would rival numerous advanced threat actors in the malware ecosystem. Game over? Maybe not….</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R8b6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R8b6i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-1" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R8j6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R8j6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R8j6i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-keynote/201077460"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Keynote</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:1" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Keynote" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/alexstamos-191203214951-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Keynote" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/alexstamos-191203214951-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Keynote</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Keynote for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r8j6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r8j6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r8j6i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r8j6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r8j6i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses some fundamental problems in technology, including a lack of empathy and diversity in teams, an overvaluation of complexity, and misaligned incentives that prioritize growth and headlines over minimizing real-world harm. It argues that technology companies have not been proactively honest about downsides and have failed to learn from past mistakes. Some recommendations are made, including emphasizing empathy and diversity to better predict harm, shifting risk ownership, adjusting incentives away from complexity and towards harm prevention, and teaching these lessons in computer science education.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R8j6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R8j6i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-2" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R8r6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R8r6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R8r6i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-guarding-against-physical-attacks-the-xbox-one-story/201074777"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Guarding Against Physical Attacks: The Xbox One Story</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:2" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Guarding Against Physical Attacks: The Xbox One Story" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tonychenfinal-191203214356-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Guarding Against Physical Attacks: The Xbox One Story" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tonychenfinal-191203214356-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Guarding Against Physical Attacks: The Xbox One Story</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Guarding Against Physical Attacks: The Xbox One Story for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r8r6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r8r6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r8r6i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r8r6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r8r6i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Tony Chen

Every game console since the first Atari was more or less designed to prevent the piracy of games and yet every single game console has been successfully modified to enable piracy. However, this trend has come to an end. Both the Xbox One and the PS4 have now been on the market for close to 6 years, without hackers being able to crack the system to enable piracy or cheating. This is the first time in history that game consoles have lasted this long without being cracked. In this talk, we will discuss how we achieved this for the Xbox One. We will first describe the Xbox security design goals and why it needs to guard against physical attacks, followed by descriptions of the hardware and software architecture to keep the Xbox secure. This includes details about the custom SoC we built with AMD and how we addressed the fact that all data read from flash, the hard drive, and even DRAM cannot be trusted. We will also discuss the corresponding software changes needed with the custom hardware to keep the system and the games secure against physical attacks.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R8r6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R8r6i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-3" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R936i7d6:" popovertarget=":R936i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R936i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-kubernetes-practical-attack-and-defense/201073355"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Kubernetes Practical Attack and Defense</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:3" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Kubernetes Practical Attack and Defense" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/jaybealefinal-191203214054-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Kubernetes Practical Attack and Defense" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/jaybealefinal-191203214054-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Kubernetes Practical Attack and Defense</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Kubernetes Practical Attack and Defense for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r936i7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r936i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r936i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r936i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r936i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Jay Beale

We will attack a real Kubernetes cluster called Bust-a-Kube, which was released in 2019 as a free learning tool. The demonstration will start by compromising a real application running in a Kubernetes pod&#x27;s container, gaining low privileged remote code execution inside that container. Next, we will explore what that compromised container can see on the cluster, finding the boundaries of its privileges. We will move laterally from that container to attack microservices on the cluster, gaining remote code execution in other containers, with higher privilege. We&#x27;ll find that one of those can interfere with a final highest-privilege container. That highest privilege container will permit us to abuse the Kubernetes API to compromise the entire cluster. This demonstration will involve graphic &quot;flags,&quot; allowing attendees to repeat the attack afterward as a downloadable solitaire &quot;capture the flag&quot; game. We&#x27;ll then discuss and perform a second demo to teach defenses, working backward to defeat necessary steps in the first demo&#x27;s chain of attacks. We&#x27;ll demonstrate using pod security policies to force an AppArmor profile onto any pod (container) being deployed. We&#x27;ll show how volume whitelists can block an attack, then demonstrate an evasion that defeats this defense. We&#x27;ll then weaken this attack with root capability limits and AppArmor. We&#x27;ll demonstrate an attack path where a bad actor can use a low-privilege Kubernetes cluster compromise to abuse the cloud provider APIs. This, in turn, leads to compromising the Kubernetes cluster more fully. We&#x27;ll discuss how to break this attack using a cloud metadata API security feature that&#x27;s Kubernetes-specific. In the course of these demonstrations, we&#x27;ll conduct the attacks both manually and with an open source attack tool called Peirates. Finally, we&#x27;ll discuss defenses that we did not use, including seccomp syscall whitelists, read-only root filesystems, and freely-available service meshes.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R936i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R936i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-4" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R9b6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R9b6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R9b6i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-open-source-security-vulnerabilities-never-come-alone/201071791"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Open Source Security, vulnerabilities never come alone</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:4" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Open Source Security, vulnerabilities never come alone" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/nicowaismanfinal-191203213741-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Open Source Security, vulnerabilities never come alone" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/nicowaismanfinal-191203213741-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Open Source Security, vulnerabilities never come alone</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Open Source Security, vulnerabilities never come alone for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r9b6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r9b6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r9b6i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r9b6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r9b6i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Nico Waisman

Open source has won and is here to stay, but it comes with challenges. Open Source security is one of them that we face as an industry. We all consume it but what about its code quality, security practices, … Over the last 3 months, Github&#x27;s Semmle Security Research Team has been triaging all open source CVEs and engaging on a subset of those performing variant analysis trying to uncover what it was missed. During this talk we will present some of these cases where we used QL to perform variant analysis, in addition to some others where we performed the full research (seed vulnerability and variant analysis) such as u-boot.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R9b6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R9b6i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-5" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R9j6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R9j6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R9j6i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat/bluehat-seattle-2019-modern-binary-analysis-with-ils"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Modern Binary Analysis with ILs</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:5" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Modern Binary Analysis with ILs" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/jordanandpeterfinal-191203213446-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Modern Binary Analysis with ILs" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/jordanandpeterfinal-191203213446-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Modern Binary Analysis with ILs</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Modern Binary Analysis with ILs for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r9j6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r9j6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r9j6i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r9j6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r9j6i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Jordan Wiens &amp; Peter LaFosse

Modern binary analysis, whether for discovering vulnerabilities or analyzing malware needs automation to deal with the volume of code under inspection. And yet, while Intermediate Languages (ILs) have been used for decades in compiler design and implementation, too few reverse engineers have any experience with them even though many reverse engineering tools (Binary Ninja, Ghidra, IDA) are built on top of ILs. Given that, it&#x27;s time to demystify this space and make it accessible beyond just computer scientists and researchers. There&#x27;s many potentially unfamiliar concepts related to ILs: single-static assignment, value-set analysis, three argument form versus tree-based designs, and others. But what matters is how these ILs can help you build better binary analysis tools. This talk not only gives you an overview of existing ILs used in reverse engineering, but more importantly, shows you how your tooling can benefit from them. From cross-platform analysis (follow a botnet from an x86-64 desktop to a mobile arm, to an embedded MIPS), to leveraging existing data-flow capabilities that brings some of the benefits both dynamic and static analysis together, this talk will demonstrate several examples of plugins that leverage ILs to improve your ability to automatically reason over compiled code.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R9j6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R9j6i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-6" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R9r6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R9r6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R9r6i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-dont-forget-to-subscribe/201068944"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Don&#x27;t forget to SUBSCRIBE.</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:6" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Don&#x27;t forget to SUBSCRIBE." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/elvisbluehat2019final-191203213131-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Don&#x27;t forget to SUBSCRIBE." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/elvisbluehat2019final-191203213131-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Don&#x27;t forget to SUBSCRIBE.</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Don&#x27;t forget to SUBSCRIBE. for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2r9r6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R2r9r6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2r9r6i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2r9r6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2r9r6i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Elvis Collado

This talk is about how an unauthenticated heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability was discovered and exploited within a router distributed by a market-leading ISP. Despite the targeted process utilizing mitigations such as DEP and ASLR, it still fell prey to known exploitation techniques. This talk will go over the thought process, failures, and road-blocks that were encountered and how they were overcame.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R9r6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R9r6i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-7" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Ra36i7d6:" popovertarget=":Ra36i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Ra36i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-im-in-your-cloud-a-year-of-hacking-azure-ad/201067968"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || I&#x27;m in your cloud: A year of hacking Azure AD</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:7" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || I&#x27;m in your cloud: A year of hacking Azure AD" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || I&#x27;m in your cloud: A year of hacking Azure AD" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/dirk-janmollema-191203212924-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || I&#x27;m in your cloud: A year of hacking Azure AD</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || I&#x27;m in your cloud: A year of hacking Azure AD for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2ra36i7d6:" popovertarget=":R2ra36i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2ra36i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2ra36i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2ra36i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Dirk-jan Mollema

How does one research the cloud? With solutions such as Azure AD and Office 365, the underlying platform architecture and designs are not publicly documented or accessible in the same way as on-premise. This makes analyzing the security of the platform harder for external researchers. In this talk I will explain the journey and discoveries of a year of trying to understand Azure AD, including the vulnerabilities discovered in the process. This ranges from gathering information about Azure AD via undocumented APIs to installing invisible backdoors and escalating privileges via limited roles or via the link with on-premise. While some of these vulnerabilities have been resolved, several of these are unintended consequences of Azure AD&#x27;s architecture and thus are important to consider when evaluating the security of your Azure AD environment. A basic understanding of Azure AD, Office 365 and its terminology is assumed for this talk.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ra36i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Ra36i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-8" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rab6i7d6:" popovertarget=":Rab6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rab6i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-autopsies-of-recent-dfir-investigations/201065970"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Autopsies of Recent DFIR Investigations</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:8" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Autopsies of Recent DFIR Investigations" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/john-lukepeckfinal-191203212500-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Autopsies of Recent DFIR Investigations" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/john-lukepeckfinal-191203212500-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Autopsies of Recent DFIR Investigations</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Autopsies of Recent DFIR Investigations for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rab6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rab6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rab6i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rab6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rab6i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">John-Luke Peck

This presentation will review in hindsight and retrospect several recent incident response engagements performed over the last 12 months by a 3rd-party (non-Microsoft affiliated) security and incident response services provider. During the talk the presenter will review what went well and what did not go well during the various engagements, with a particular focus on the data, services , and support available from Microsoft &amp; Office365/AzureAD, and how they were and were not able to be leveraged during the various engagements.

This will include a focus on areas where:
* Necessary data was not available because the client had not taken, or were unaware of the need to take, steps to enable collection of the data 
* The data &amp; services available were successfully used during response efforts 

The presentation will highlight: 
* Lessons learned about Office365/AzureAD and Incident Response 
* How Office365, AzureAD, and ATP services and data were used in the response efforts 
* Recommendations for Office365/AzureAD tenants to improve their security &amp; IR capabilities /before/ an incident occurs 
All presented examples and incidents will be de-identified to maintain and protect privacy and operational security. 

What this is NOT: 
* A service provider&#x27;s sales presentation </span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rab6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rab6i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-9" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Raj6i7d6:" popovertarget=":Raj6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Raj6i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/bluehat-seattle-2019-the-good-the-bad-the-ugly-of-ml-based-approaches-for-ransomware-detection/201064852"><span class="sr-only">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The good, the bad &amp; the ugly of ML based approaches f...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:9" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The good, the bad &amp; the ugly of ML based approaches f..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/lichenravisahita-191203212233-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The good, the bad &amp; the ugly of ML based approaches f..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/lichenravisahita-191203212233-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The good, the bad &amp; the ugly of ML based approaches f...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || The good, the bad &amp; the ugly of ML based approaches f... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2raj6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R2raj6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2raj6i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2raj6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2raj6i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Li Chen &amp; Ravi Sahita

In this talk, we juxtapose the resiliency and trustworthiness of composition of DL and classical ML algorithms for security, via a case study of evaluating the resiliency of ransomware detection via the generative adversarial network (GAN). We propose to use GAN to automatically produce dynamic features that exhibit generalized malicious behaviors that can reduce the efficacy of black-box ransomware classifiers. We examine the quality of the GAN-generated samples by comparing the statistical similarity of these samples to real ransomware and benign software. Further we investigate the latent subspace where the GAN-generated samples lie and explore reasons why such samples cause a certain class of ransomware classifiers to degrade in performance. The automatically generated adversarial samples can then be fed into the training set to reduce the blind spots of the detectors. 

There has been a surge of interest in using machine learning (ML) particularly deep learning (DL) to automatically detect malware through their dynamic behaviors. These approaches have achieved significant improvement in detection rates and lower false positive rates at large scale compared with traditional malware analysis methods. ML in threat detection has demonstrated to be a good cop to guard platform security. However it is imperative to evaluate - is ML-powered security resilient enough? 

To generate reliable traces of system activity, we can utilize CPU-based telemetry such as Intel Processor Trace which can be extracted via a hypervisor without guest instrumentation. We advocate that file I/O events extracted from Intel processor trace together with algorithmic improvements have shown potential stronger defense in ML -based model deployment in the wild to combat ransomware attack. Our results and discoveries should pose relevant questions for defenders such as how ML models can be made more resilient for robust enforcement of security objectives. </span></div></div><div class="" id=":Raj6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Raj6i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-10" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rar6i7d6:" popovertarget=":Rar6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rar6i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" Why Does Application Security Take ...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:10" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img There Yet: Why Does Application Security Take ...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Are We There Yet: Why Does Application Security Take ... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rar6i7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rar6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rar6i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rar6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rar6i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes the findings of Veracode&#x27;s 10th annual State of Software Security report. The report is based on scan data from over 85,000 applications assessed between April 2018 and March 2019. Key findings include: (1) Most security flaws are eventually fixed but fix times have remained consistent, (2) The likelihood of flaws being fixed decreases over time leading to growing &quot;security debt&quot;, (3) Frequent scanning correlated with faster fix times and lower security debt indicating the benefits of DevSecOps practices. The data suggests security testing automation still lags DevOps adoption and developers prioritize recent flaws over severity.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rar6i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rar6i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-11" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rb36i7d6:" popovertarget=":Rb36i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rb36i7d6"><a Secure Machine Learning Pipelines: Security ...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:11" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Building Secure Machine Learning Pipelines: Security ..." class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Building Secure Machine Learning Pipelines: Security ...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save BlueHat Seattle 2019 || Building Secure Machine Learning Pipelines: Security ... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R2rb36i7d6:" popovertarget=":R2rb36i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R2rb36i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R2rb36i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R2rb36i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat">BlueHat Security Conference</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Anamitra Dutta Majumdar &amp; Anubhav Saini

Increasing adoption of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence by data-driven organizations like LinkedIn is posing some important challenges related to data security and privacy. On the one hand, member data is an asset that unlocks unlimited business potential whereas, on the other hand, the consumption of the data must happen in a secure and privacy-preserving manner. This poses an interesting challenge for security and operations teams in the organization. In this presentation, we will walk through all the well-known use cases of machine learning at LinkedIn and also the phases of a machine learning pipeline. We will identify key security gaps and the corresponding security controls to address the gaps at each phase of any machine learning pipeline. The associated scalability and operational challenges for the application of security control will be explained. Controls in each phase would be put into the perspective of the Productive Machine Learning pipeline phases being built at LinkedIn There will be a section on how Blueshift will impact the application of security controls once compute and data have been decoupled. By the end of the talk, we would have described what a secure machine learning pipeline looks like and what are the key security patterns to be put in place to secure the pipeline.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rb36i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rb36i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-12" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbb6i7d6:" popovertarget=":Rbb6i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbb6i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:12" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A
